fields.description: Error code: {{3d7ae21c4e834ebe94790b3cce43785c}}
fields.summary: Error refreshing PR

fields.description:
!485409420-issues.jpeg|thumbnail!

Just a suggestion, but I think it was better when the tags had the background color to indicate its status. I find it more difficult now to take a quick glimpse on the issues status.
fields.summary: Put the background color back to issues status

fields.description: I recently wanted to change my avatar on my bitbucket profile. BitBucket sent me to my Atlassian account to do it. I changed my avatar there. It still does not appear in BitBucket.
fields.summary: Bitbucket avatar not updated to new avatar from atlassian account settings.

fields.description:
When using API v2 to get branches

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/refs/branches/%7Bname%7D

It is not possible to query for a list of open branches. This is a huge problem when using mercurial. In mercurial it is not possible to delete branches (afaik), they are just closed, so querying this endpoint returns a huge number of pages.

When using API v1, it was possible to get a list containing only open branches.
fields.summary: API v2 endpoint for branches is including closed branches
Test results don't work out of the box with Gradle 3+

fields.description: 'Description' and 'Reviewers' boxes are missing and 'Create Pull Request' button is greyed out.
fields.summary: Can't Create Pull Request

fields.description:
As the title suggests, in the diff screen do not just show nothing for binary files. Say explicitly that the diff cannot be shown because the file is binary.

It's not always obvious what files are treated as binary, which can create false impression that there's no diff. This gets even worse with text files using UTF-16 and UTF-32 encoding, that are currently seen as binary by Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Explicitly say "diff cannot be shown for binary files" when showing diff for binary files.

fields.description:
It would be fairly trivial to change the the current members page to be a table rather than the current box/card approach.

Usability will improve and also provide the opportunity to present other information about team members eg number of repo's they have access to, number of groups they are part of etc.
fields.summary: Team Member Page Layout Changes

fields.description:
Hi,\\
When commit message contains issues number (#123) and word fixed, a comment is made on the issue with commit number (and issues is closed).

It would be nice if any mention of issue number in commit message will create a comment on the issue with a link to that commit. The perfect state will be that the comment on the issue will also include the commit message.

This could be an optional feature, but I would really like it.

We have a practice of making commit messages like:

"Working on XYZ to allow BCLOUD-123 in future" or "XYZ linked to BCLOUD-123 and BCLOUD-321"

It would be nice to see all those commits linked from the issue. Yeah... We are using issues more like roadmap / planned features and often more than one commit is needed to fully resolve the issue.\\
Also, our issues are synced to Asana where a manager can track the progress... With this comments, he/she can see that something is happening about that "task" (issue) without devs needed to comment manually.
fields.summary: All commits with issues ID will create comment in issue
Pull request list request fails with 500 error if a participant of a PR is a deleted user

fields.description:
If I setup a pipeline to build with gradle and a gradlewrapper and also configure to use a cache for gradle and gradlewrapper my snapshot dependencies aren't refreshed as expected.\\
If I disable cache for gradle the dependencies is updated correctly if I run the same build on my local machine the dependencies are updated so I believe that there is a cache invalidation bug in pipelines regarding snapshot releases.
fields.summary: Gradle build and snapshot dependencies

fields.description:
Hi :)

In my team repos, we added all 3 environments to our Bitbucket Pipelines to get the Deployments feature. That has been working great!

Recently, we decided to have continuous deployment to Staging, so we no longer need to have a "test" environment. We have removed it from our pipelines config file, but the environment still remains on the Deployments page.

Would it be possible to hide a deployment environment if that environment is no longer in the Pipelines config? Or maybe have a setting that allows certain environments to be hidden?

That would be great, as currently our test environment is just reporting the same old Pipelines run that was last "deployed" to it and no longer gets updated.
fields.summary: Hide an unused Pipelines Deployment environment

fields.description: In somecase, I want to notice to my email or sms when the pipeline build failed, or do something like that. So I think it's nice to have the feature trigger bitbucket pipeline, it's like webhooks that bitbucket have built.
fields.summary: Add Trigger build success or failed bitbucket pipeline

fields.description: We'd like to be able to override the default behavior of the "Merge" button on pull requests -- specifically, we'd like to be able to disable/gray it out by default, and enable it only when various automated tests have run. Currently the button is active even when merges are impossible due to merge checks.
fields.summary: API to override default behavior of "Merge" button on pull requests

fields.description:
I would like to see the test-reporting for bitbucket pipelines report the successful tests as well. Our need to see successful tests is for reporting to a regulatory body in the case of an audit on our products.

For every public release of software we have to produce documentation to show that it has been tested and meets the specification. As such, it would greatly help to be able to list the successful tests of a pipeline run.
fields.summary: See output of successful test results

fields.description:
Something went wrong\\
While we check things on our end, refresh the page and contact support if the problem persists.

When contacting support, provide them with this code:

c1ce3479183145d08a8d3d5ac470990b

Our status page may also provide additional details.
fields.summary: Import repository error

fields.description:
Performing a commit on the UI and/or immediately mark it to open a "Pull Request" is not working.

h3. How to Replicate
# Try to create a commit on any repository using the UI.
# Before you press commit, mark the box to create a Pull Request.
# After press "Commit", you will face an error message.

* The same happens if you do not follow the step 2.

!2198983211-Screen%20Shot%202018-02-27%20at%2009.13.16.png|thumbnail!

!3560618985-Screen%20Shot%202018-02-27%20at%2009.15.09.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Performing a commit on the UI and/or immediately mark it to open a "Pull Request" is not working

fields.description:
Hi guys,

we're currently setting up our bitbucket account (using the free 5-user plan). We have 5 users in our team, but when trying to assign them to different user groups we are triggering the 5-user-limit warning and are prompted to upgrade our plan.

What are we doing wrong?

Attached screenshots of our users on plan and the dialogs to add one of the existing users to the administrators groups, which does not work.

Thanks a lot for looking into this.

Regards,\\
Michael.
fields.summary: Adding existing teammates to user group triggers 5-user limit warning

fields.description:
In my Pipeline, I have a last step which is a deployment manual step (using Bitbucket Deployments). After all the previous steps being successful, I proceed to click in the "Run" button to execute this deployment step. After clicking on the button, the screen gets darker and the Deployments confirmation modal *does not* appear, leaving me in a stuck state, since I can't click on anything and leaving no option but refreshing the page.

My last successful deploy was on February 15th, so I'm not sure when -- in the meantime -- this bug started happening.

I've attached a screenshot containing a JS error captured in my Chrome console.
fields.summary: Pipelines Deployment (manual) step getting stuck after clicking "Run"
Submitting comments with keyboard shortcut should use OS specific shortcut

fields.description:
Pull Request-Replying to a Comment output a lengthy red string and would not allow the comment to be posted. I've cleared cache and still am not able to comment to this comment, and it keeps displaying this massive error.

Edit: This seems to only be replicated by using the browser: Brave
fields.summary: Error when submitting a pull request comment in Brave browser

fields.description:
Hi,

Please deactivate pipeline in this account.
fields.summary: Stop Pipeline

fields.description:
We use Mercurial with the evolve extension enabled.

From time to time Pipelines runs a build on obsolete changes. One example is when merging a PR where the branch to merge in has obsolete heads. When doing the merge, Pipelines runs for the actual current head of the branch to merge (good) plus obsolete heads on that branch (bad).

Note that we use named branches for topic branches for PR.

I could provide an example Pipelines run in a private message.
fields.summary: Do not run pipelines on obsolete changesets

fields.description:
Hello,\\
We integrate Jenkins with Bitbucket with a Bitbucket Jenkins plugin. Which uses a Webhook to enable automatic builds. But recently the webhook stopped working, the logs show that the request timed out.\\
!3376697439-bitbucket-hook-error.jpg|thumbnail!

I have looked at the docs, but can't find anything
fields.summary: Webhook Request time out
Keyboard shortcuts helpscreen broken

fields.description: I'd love to find all active (ahead of master) branches across multiple repositories or within a single project without clicking through all repositories manually.
fields.summary: Track all active branches across repositories/projects

fields.description: I have issue that cant commit and delete the specific repo. https://bitbucket.org/EdisonTKPcom/adsmanager
fields.summary: cant commit and cant delete the specific repo

fields.description:
From an Enterprise point of view,  and admin perspective, this feature is great.

Take for example of provisioning a team of 100 people,  we expect a naming convention.

It would be great if I can import an csv file to bulk create users.

UserId,UserEmailID,UserGroup,SendInvite\\
sfdv.SriniK,sriniK@domain.com,auth_code_branch,Y\\
sfdv.RobertM,RobertM@domain.com,auth_code_branch,Y
fields.summary: New Feature - Provision new UserID - Link with Email Account - Send Invite

fields.description:
We rely on webhooks to kick off our CI/CD flows. We recently had some webhooks not come through for ~15min and since status.bitbucket.com was all-green so it was hard to know if they were ever going to come through or not.

The webhooks did come through a few minutes later and if we had been able to see that the webhooks were delayed on the status page we wouldn't have needed to worry about working on contingencies or reaching out to support.
fields.summary: Surface webhook latency on status.bitbucket.com

fields.description:
I like to manage permissions on project level (as in bitbucket server). I assume it is pretty obvious why I want to it but just in case:\\
Usually we assign users to groups. Repositories are grouped by project. Instead of having the efforts to set group permissions on each repository, it saves a lot of money being able to do it on project level.
fields.summary: managing permisions on project level

fields.description:
My user account appears to still have an old SSH key associated with it that allows access access to the repo but is not listed in the SSH key section.

The SSH key allows commits under my name but assuming that the public key is assigned to another account.

We have the username and pass for the other account but not the email address. We have no way to login as the user to remove the key or to identify the email address (login with username is no longer supported)

Through trial and error we managed to identify the email address used to create the account and now have access. However removing the user from the team and all permission groups does not revoke access to the repos. The associated key is still valid and the user can login and view all repos. This account was an old 2014 account with an old RSA Key (<2048 ).
fields.summary: Can't remove old SSH key from user

fields.description: Prior to the lastest update to the dashboard, the Pull Requests I've already approved did not show on the view.  Now under my work, these are still showing after reviewing and when there are a large number of open Pull Requests it is a little more difficult to see which ones I still need to address.
fields.summary: Filter Pull Requests I've approved from dashboard

fields.description: Would like the option to set an expiry date for App password
fields.summary: App Password Expiry date
oauth2 access_token generation with grant type of client_credentials requires callback uri

fields.description: The logged-in user should be the first in the list of Reviewers in the "Pull requests to review" so if the filters are not selected to see that you have reviewed the pull request and not having to click on the {{+}} icon to figure out whether you did or not.
fields.summary: Pull requests to review - Reviewers

fields.description:
i'm trying to use molecule ( test ansible) with bitbukcet pipeline.

so i dont have a choice, i would activate the --privileged flag.

bitbucket refuse that, how can i do ?

----
docker: Error response from daemon: authorization denied by plugin pipelines: Command not supported.

----
fields.summary: Allow privileged mode for docker in docker

fields.description:
Could just be random fluctuations, but it appears that pipelines take longer when watching the progress on the site, to when run without. Marking as {{major}} as this is conceivably costing us money.

Example of randomly selected step, with no code changes to the code being tested...

Not watching progress on the website:

{code}

Test Users JS
45 tests passed
51s

{code}

Watching on the website:

{code}

Test Users JS
45 tests passed
1m 50s

{code}
fields.summary: Pipeline seems to take considerably longer if watching it

fields.description:
I have a team member with write access to one of our repositories. He has never had issues logging in until today when he attempted to login through google. When he logged in and went to the project it said he was not a part of any projects.

He restarted, tried in different browsers, incognito and no luck. He is able to commit fine, it just seems to be a browser thing

Are there any known issues with google login that could be causing this? Any other thoughts?

Thanks!\\
Kyle
fields.summary: Team member appears to have lost access to the repo after logging in through gmail

fields.description:
According to this article (https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/import-or-convert-code-from-an-existing-tool-795937450.html), we should be able to import source code from github to our bitbucket account. Because github admin has required us to use 2-factor authentication, we can't disable it. I found also this article (https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/importing-data-from-github-861253690.html) saying that the Jira importer supports 2-factor auth.

Would it be possible to get 2-factor auth support also to bitbucket import?
fields.summary: Add support for Github's 2-factor authentication to repository importer

fields.description:
Hi,

Currently pipeline needs access/secret keys for deployment/testing against AWS services. This is rather cumbersome and not nearly as secure as role based deployment.

Specifically, EC2 instances can be launched with privileged roles that grant access to other AWS products. Not sure how this can be supported without Issue BCLOUD-15674 but this would be really useful for us.
fields.summary: Support IAM roles for pipelines for AWS

fields.description:
We have had the on- and offgoing problem of PRs showing up in Jira tickets only with a significant delay. Currently the delay is (once again) more than 20 minutes.\\
Current example:\\
Jiraticket:  https://sabioteam.atlassian.net/browse/S5-2460\\
PR: https://bitbucket.org/sabio-de/sabio/pull-requests/1859/

The last time I reported this it was with Jira and they referred me to you.
fields.summary: PRs shown in Jira only with significant delay

fields.description: We get notified that a pipeline failed, but we do not get to know if it came back on track.
fields.summary: When a failed pipeline recovers due to next commit, original committer should be informed

fields.description:
Refer to the followin\\
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-73123
fields.summary: When Pipeline can not start for any reason, it should inform the committer or repo owner

fields.description:
This has been an issue for years. Just bothering me again, because

# you still haven't fixed it
# I just lost a file because I assumed it was uploaded

I'm sure someone has reported this already.

Go ahead try it yourself, upload a file to the Downloads area. Grab a totally different file, rename it to match same name and extension, and reupload.\\
Old file remains when you click download, new file doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Upload file to [Downloads] area, broken if same name.ext file

fields.description:
When a repository has a large number of empty directories in {{refs/}}, performance degrades, sometimes to the point of timeouts and 500s when accessing, loading or creating a new PR.

Ensure that empty directories are cleaned up repos in order to avoid timeouts and improve customer experience.
fields.summary: Large numbers of empty directories in refs/ causes performance issues (BBCDEV-9140)

fields.description:
I setup a simple pull request:

[forked repo] somebranchname -> [original repo] somebranchname (new)

But, when I create a new branch in a forked repo, then create a pull request for my new branch to a new branch with the same name on the source repo, I can't edit and change the target branch, it will get stuck on the "somebranchname (new)" branch. The only way I can change the pull request to another (existing) branch in the original repo is be creating a completely new pull request.
fields.summary: Cannot change destination branch

fields.description:
In large companies it is necessary to monitor the activity of users who work with the most important assets, such as source codes, to control actions that may compromise the company's operational continuity. The elimination of repositories and the change of permissions are events that must be monitored to validate that they are authorized and approved by the responsible organizational unit.\\
For this reason Bitbucket Cloud should allow monitoring the events handled by the Audit Log in an automated way, either through the API or as a webhook.

Attentive to your comments, greetings.
fields.summary: Monitoring Security events in Bitbucket Cloud

fields.description:
Hi there,

I encountered a problem when I tried to switch branches while viewing a source code file.\\
It leads me to a 404.

Cheers,

Clemens Chu
fields.summary: Cannot change branch while viewing code

fields.description:
As a recommendation to better force users like myself (to-much-text-did-not-read-type-of-person) to save the recovery codes, you should emphasize this information (marked in screenshot with a red border) and make it a requirement to press “Show recovery codes” before the 2-step-verification can be activated.

You could also add functionality to e-mail the codes or send them by mobile text if forgotten. If security would be an issue, this functionality could be optionally activated with a user setting.

This problem tends to happen quite a bit since the authenticator app setup in mobile phones are mostly excluded from backups. Every time a user switches/reinstall phone or loose/breaks phone the recovery codes are the only way to recover an account. Sometimes SSH key can be used to restore recovery codes, but this recovery process is a bit random with "permission denied" messages etc..

!2641758692-example.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Minimize risk of being locked out from account with 2FA

fields.description:
h1. Reproduction Steps
# Visit https://bitbucket.org/brandondahler-vanick/spacesbug/src/0e7d0188479031bd69c125b8143be01074cdaa89?at=master in Google Chrome.
# Click "Example With Spaces"
# Note top path has %20 for spaces.\\
!3981862155-ExampleWithSpaces.jpg|thumbnail!

h1. Notes
I believe the issue has to do with the AJAX loading of the page, because when you visit the folder directly via https://bitbucket.org/brandondahler-vanick/spacesbug/src/0e7d0188479031bd69c125b8143be01074cdaa89/Example%20With%20Spaces/?at=master , the same text is displayed correctly.
fields.summary: Spaces converted to %20 in folder name during AJAX load

fields.description:
When viewing list of commits, link to the jira issue doesn't behave as link: it opens some jira-integration-popup (that is even not loading half of the time). It was like this before for different parts of the system (popup instead of just redirect to jira issue): but I had workaround: cmd+click on the link to open it in new tab, now even that is not working.

Please, make links as the links.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Link to jira issue in commits-view doesn't behave as link.

fields.description:
When trying to edit a file online and setting it to automatically create a Pull Request upon commit, we're getting the error "We had trouble creating your pull request." Upon further checking, the branch is actually created and the commit is successful. However the PR failed to be created. Creating the PR manually has no issues.

The error in the console shows Error 404 - Branch not Found.

!1744278548-Capture.PNG|thumbnail!

_Steps to reproduce_

# Browse source file on Bitbucket Cloud
# Edit the file
# Click Commit
# Check box to automatically create pull request.
# Click commit and it shows the error
# Check that the commit is successful and the branch is created.
fields.summary: Unable to automatically create PR when committing from Bitbucket UI

if you valid each commits  one by one.\\
it doesn't valid the global PR.

fields.description:
Dears,

Please take into consideration adding some info related to number of issue assigned per user and total open issues.

I am adding in attachment a sample as model.

Thanks & best regards:\\
Abhijeet Chakravorty

fields.description:
Hi

Currently pipelines execute on Bitbucket provided infrastructure. This runs into multiple issues such as:

# Inability to use existing fixtures/databases/services for code being tested.
# Security limitations such as executing pipeline over instances with pre-assigned roles (currently this is handled via SECRET/ACCESS keys)
# Copying large amounts of data as opposed to using a pre-existing container with pre-loaded data

The ability to deploy pipelines to user provided infrastructure should mitigate this! Please enable support for the same
fields.summary: Support executing pipeline on user provided infrastructure

fields.description:
Hi,

when I am trying to clone repository using https URLit works. However when I am tring to clone using SSH, it is not working. Please help. please see below issue while try to clone using SSH.

$ git clone git@bitbucket.org:redboxdigital/amasty-module-base.git\\
Cloning into 'amasty-module-base'...\\
Connection to bitbucket.org closed by remote host.\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.
fields.summary: cloning issue

fields.description:
A PR is linked with a Jira issue by specifying the Issue Key in the title. The issue Key should be a link pointing to the Jira Issue.

Sometimes issue key becomes the link and the rest of the title stops being a link.

!2201594522-1.PNG|thumbnail!

The image below shows the BCLOUD-5 as a link to the PR and the Issue Key being a link to the Jira Issue. The title "Master" stops being a link\\
!3140382550-PR.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Pull Request title should link to PR when JIRA Issue Key is included

fields.description:
Set a pipeline webhook (drone.io) in a repo, developers report that sometime, the latest commit doesn't {{repo:push}} to that pipeline, then pipeline missed and can't  build with that commit.

!1072124520-2000.png|thumbnail!

but in fact, a new commit was pushed.

Second, can I re-submit in webhook and sync the commits to backend pipeline in Bitbucket Cloud?  I click {{load new requests}} button, no differences.
fields.summary: The latest commits don't `repo:push` via webhook and how to resubmitting webhook EDITED

fields.description:
Hello,

For two days now, I am unable to merge anything into my repository.\\
https://bitbucket.org/TYMPAN/code_tympan

The merging seems to take indefinite time. Same thing happens when I try to sync another repository with this one.

Edit 18/02/2018 : When I try to push anything to the repository, I get this error : HTTP Error: 500 (Internal Server Error). I think it might be because of an interrupted merge...

Thank you for your help

NB : I tried on multiple navigators : chrome, firefox, safari and I always have the same problem
fields.summary: HTTP Error: 500 (Internal Server Error) : Can't merge anything

fields.description:
Navigate to the Branches tab within a project that has branches that are behind and ahead of main branch.

View Column for behind/ahead, while the 'behind' grey bar aligns to the '|' start the 'ahead' blue bar does not
fields.summary: Ahead bar within Branches tab isn't aligned to start line

fields.description: I've tried sourcetree, github desktop and dw to both commit and push change. I can commit without a problem, but when I try to push - it says/looks like it was successful in each client (or at least, there is no error), but doesn't ever show on the remote.
fields.summary: Can commit, but not push

fields.description: Suppose you get a Slack notification telling you that a Pipeline has finished its first step automatically. The next step is a manual one - it would be great to be able to trigger it directly from Slack!
fields.summary: Allow running manual step from the Slack notification

fields.description:
Hello,

WYSIWYG editor is really annoying. Using MD format and templates is crucial for DEVELOPERS.

Please make this buggy UI optional
fields.summary: Turn off WYSIWYG editor for PRs

fields.description:
My SSH keys get added to my personal account when I try to add them for the team I'm administering

Steps to Reproduce :

# Go to Team -> Settings -> SSH Keys
# Click Add key
# Enter the key details and add key
# Wait or reload the page

What happens : The key doesn't appear on the list. When I try to add it, it says "Someone has already added this key"

After spending some time, I finally managed to see where the key went, it went to my bitbucket settings

Please fix this!
fields.summary: Unable to edit SSH Key on the Team (SSH key goes missing)

fields.description:
Tried adding an SSH key to our organisation settings.

However, everytime you add it, it shows up under the user's personal ssh keys rather than the organisations SSH keys.

This is preventing us from integrating our CI workflow which depends on two repositories from the organisation to clone the other.
fields.summary: SSH Key - Adding a New SSH Key to the organisation always adds it to the Individual rather than the organisation

fields.description:
This is an issue using the search that's launched by pressing '.' on my dashboard. (not sure what that feature is called...)

When I search for a repo called "orm", any other repo with "orm" in the name will show up first in the drop down list.  If I have several different repos with "orm" in the name, the "orm" repo may not even show up at all.  It would be ideal to show exact matches at the top of the list, with the other partial matches following after.  This has happened to me with a couple of different repo names, and the only workaround that I've found is to open the search on the left sidebar.
fields.summary: Search should match first on exact matches, then partial matches

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to see the results of a query like "me in reviewers AND my review status is 'OPEN'" so I can find PRs I'm supposed to review but haven't yet.
fields.summary: See pull requests I haven't reviewed yet.

fields.description:
We have the (experimental) evolve extension enabled for mercurial and generally are quite happy with Bitbucket's support for that mercurial extension. However, today I recognized an issue in context of pull requests.

A PR has been merged accidentally. We pruned the merge commit to undo the change. The first problem was, that the PR was still marked as "merged", although the merge commit is obsolete now. To work around this, we created a new PR. This new PR had, as intended, all commits on the topic branch included. The problem is, though, that when looking at the PR _now_, only commits done since the previous accidental merge are listed.

It looks like the PR diff is done using the commits on the topic branch and commits on _any_ head on the default branch. This is wrong. Only the tip (most recent non-obsolete) head on default branch should be used to render the diff between topic branch and default.
fields.summary: Pull request diff incorrect due to obsolete commits (mercurial)

fields.description:
Hello,

I report the problem here but I'm not sure if the problem is with Bitbucket Cloud or SourceTree...

I'm still trying to figure out why but I have just done another clone (with sourcetree) and last hour edits are not visibles (before that it was a full month off).

Things where looking fine before but it started to get mixed up when I tried to add image in the repository while editing text via the web.

At some point, the local cloned version started to desynchronized (trying to get master was without effect).

Any idea?

At first I tought it was a conflict because my repos was named something like myrepo-wiki, so the clone is myrepo-wiki/wiki. It was not conclusive but maybe it could be a source of conflict?
fields.summary: Unstable wiki edit when using cloned repo and online edit

fields.description:
Hi, I have some .md files in my repo, there is piece of code form one of files.

{code}
#!

#### Prefork
Calculation for values are follows:
* Memory reserve for Database (MDB): 1024MB
* Memory reserve for OS (MOS): 10% of RAM
* Average Process Size (APS): ~20MB

Memory for Apache (MA) = RAM * 1024 - (MDB + MOS)\
MaxClients = MA/APS
{code}

I expect result like in attachment "markdow-expectation.jpg", this is preview from PhpStorm, but when I push code to repo result is like in attachment "markdown-result.jpg"\\
I was trying '-', '+' and '*', same results.

We see that unsorted list is not rendered properly. Sometimes I have problem with new line too, you can see it in "markdown-result.jpg"

Regards

Are the IP adresses of the outbound webhooks still current on https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html?

When I manually kick off a webhook, tcpdump shows zero traffic from bitbucket at the destination server.

Not sure if this is related, but I also noticed yesterday for a long time that webhook information was not available in the bitbucket UI.
fields.summary: webhooks broken after scheduled maintenance

fields.description:
Hi! Is there a way to share steps in Bitbucket pipelines? Aka write it once, and use it several places?

If I for example wanted to build a JAR on every commit, but only upload it somewhere if the branch was production.

To achieve this today, I have to do somethink like this:

{code}
#!yaml

pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        name: Build
        image: maven:3.3.9
        script:
          - mvn package
        artifacts:
          - target/my-project-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
  branches:
    production:
      - step:
          name: Build
          image: maven:3.3.9
          script:
            - mvn package
          artifacts:
            - target/my-project-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
      - step:
          name: Upload
          image: python:3.6-alpine
          script:
            - python ./upload-jar.py
{code}

You can see that this step is implemented exactly the same for default and for branch master:

{code}
    - step:
        name: Build
        image: maven:3.3.9
        script:
          - mvn package
        artifacts:
          - target/my-project-1.0-SNAPSHOT.jar
{code}

I'm a fan of DRY. is there a way to define this step once, and use it both places?
fields.summary: Shared steps

fields.description: When I change the default branch of a repo I receive an repo:updated webhook with an empty   "changes" hash, there is neither an information about the default_branch in the request body.

fields.description:
Reproduction steps:

# Go to open a pull request (I'm positive comments, etc. will also cause this)
# Click on the "image" button to attach an image.
# Click "Select an Image" in the modal to open the system file selector
# Select a file, so the file selector closes.
# Click "Select an Image" again, but this time, cancel out of the dialog box.
# Hit "Upload".

Expected behavior is that the file should still upload and get attached, even though I've changed my mind about what file I want to attach.

In actuality, the upload refuses to proceed if the file selector dialog was cancelled rather than submitted before.
fields.summary: Upload refuses in image attachment when canceling from the browser file-selector

fields.description:
Hello!

When we download an archive of the repository, at least as a zip file, the special characters in filenames (files and directories), metadata, are incorrectly decoded on Windows (at least the build 16299.125), but are fine on Linux (my OS, Manjaro Linux, with UTF-8 encoding) and Mac (from what Yana Bazulina said).

For example, if the repository contains these 2 files: "test dʼapostrophe spéciale" and "résultat", the basic extractor (not 7-zip, it seems) will show: "test d╩╝apostrophe sp├®ciale" and "r├®sultat".

It seems it is because the basic extractor (the one used when you right-click on a file from an Explorer window and select "Extract All...") follows exactly the norm (https://www.loc.gov/preservation/digital/formats/digformatspecs/APPNOTE%2820120901%29_Version_6.3.3.txt, APPENDIX D - Language Encoding (EFS)): if the 11th bit is not set, it will be seen as a cp437 encoding, rather than UTF-8.

I cannot change that client-side, and I cannot force users to change their extractor, so the only way seems to modify some parameters on your default zip archive. :-)

Note that Linux and Github zip files don't seem to have this problem either, and their 11th is set.

Thank you for your work.
fields.summary: Encoding errors for metadata in ZIP archive of repository on Windows
